duties_responsibilities.duty: Maintain perpetual collection of open-source information to detect potential threats against the ministry and staff
Produce and disseminate intelligence products derived from open-source and vendor-provided collection efforts
Produce GIS products to support alerts and reports including daily incident plotting
Act as a focal point for threat-related information using communication and systems
Monitor facilities, assets, and access control
Answer, document, and respond to calls coming in on the Critical Incident Phone Line; perform initial crisis management with caller
Maintain situational awareness for all ministry locations around the world and respond appropriately when there is a critical incident in those regions

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree (B.A., B.S.) in International Relations, Intelligence Studies, History, Political Science, Social Sciences, or other relevant field; three (3) years’ experience in the international security or analytical field preferred; or equivalent combination of education and experience; International work experience preferred
GIS Certificate or willingness to complete within first 2-3 years in the position
12 credit hours of college-level Biblical Studies (preferred)
